pension somebody/something ↔ off.transla: to make someone leave their job when they are old or ill, and pay them a pension
Not everyone wants to be pensioned off at 65.
to get rid of something because it is old or not useful anymore
Many of the old ships have been pensioned off.
to make someone who is old or ill leave their job and pay them a pension
He had worked hard all his life, and in three years they would pension him off.
to get rid of something because it is too old or not useful any more
Old coal-fired power stations will be pensioned off.
